channel.title: Extruding Problem
channel.description:
So I'm working on a [s]Vending Machine[/s] new project and I want to extrude inside the shape then add a hyperNURB.. Before I add a hyperNURB it looks like I want it (The part I want to extrude anyways..)
[IMG]http://img91.imageshack.us/img91/3412/beforedh1.jpg[/img]
But after I add the hyperNURB, the rest of the erm.. "Project" looks good but not the part I want to extrude :\
[IMG]http://img523.imageshack.us/img523/3708/aftervv2.jpg[/img]
Is there any way to fix this without using a fillet/boole?
Tried to make it as clear as possible :\

item.title: Extruding Problem
item.dc:creator: @FastBallz FastBawlz
item.description:
@FastBallz wrote:

[quote=“SomethingToHide, post:2, topic:151557”]Wait, you want the outside edges HyperNURBSed but the extruded part almost perfectly creased?

Get out the knife tool, make it Loop, and get a loop that goes all the way around the inside extruded part, and try to get it really close the the egde where the sides are. If you know what I mean. experiment with that and you should get what you’re looking for.[/quote]

^^Worked thanks, didn’t think about using knife tool…

Read full topic

item.title: Extruding Problem
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

Wait, you want the outside edges HyperNURBSed but the extruded part almost perfectly creased?

Get out the knife tool, make it Loop, and get a loop that goes all the way around the inside extruded part, and try to get it really close the the egde where the sides are. If you know what I mean. experiment with that and you should get what you’re looking for.

Read full topic
